Inference Tasks Documentation¶

OpenSeismic allows users to not only conduct regular inference on data, but it also helps users conduct critical inference tasks on seismic data. Below introduce the functions responsible for conducting inference. Read their descriptions in order to understand how to specify them in your configuration JSON file.

Regular Inference¶

core.python.infer_regular.infer_sync(arg_obj, logger, get_functions)¶

Synchronously infer as normal. In order to use this in your configuration, specify infer_type as sync.

Parameters

  • arg_obj – Arguments object that holds parameters needed for inference.

  • logger – Common logger object for logging coherence.

  • get_functions – Functions associated with parameters given.

Returns

None

core.python.infer_regular.infer_async(arg_obj, logger, get_functions)¶

Asynchronously infer as normal. In order to use this in your configuration, specify infer_type as async.

Parameters

  • arg_obj – Arguments object that holds parameters needed for inference.

  • logger – Common logger object for logging coherence.

  • get_functions – Functions associated with parameters given.

Returns

Coarse Cube Inference¶

core.python.infer_coarse_cube.infer_coarse_cubed_sync(arg_obj, logger, get_functions)¶

Infer on 3D seismic data synchronously with coarse cube output. In order to use this in your configuration, specify infer_type as coarse_cube_sync. Fine cubed inference requires that additional parameters such as im_size and window be specified in the JSON configuration file. This function’s specific arguments will be filled according to your configuration inputs.

Parameters

  • arg_obj – Arguments object that holds parameters needed for inference.

  • logger – Common logger object for logging coherence.

  • get_functions – Functions associated with parameters given.

Returns

None

Fine Cube Inference¶

core.python.infer_fine_cube.infer_fine_cubed_sync(arg_obj, logger, get_functions)¶

Infer on 3D seismic data synchronously with fine cube output. In order to use this in your configuration, specify infer_type as fine_cube_sync. Fine cubed inference requires that additional parameters such as slice, subsampl, im_size, slice_no, and return_to_fullsize be specified in the JSON configuration file. This function’s specific arguments will be filled according to your configuration inputs.

Parameters

  • arg_obj – Arguments object that holds parameters needed for inference.

  • logger – Common logger object for logging coherence.

  • get_functions – Functions associated with parameters given.

Returns

None

core.python.infer_fine_cube.infer_fine_cubed_async(arg_obj, logger, get_functions)¶

Infer on 3D seismic data asynchronously with fine cube output. In order to use this in your configuration, specify infer_type as fine_cube_async. Fine cubed inference requires that additional parameters such as slice, subsampl, im_size, slice_no, and return_to_fullsize be specified in the JSON configuration file. This function’s specific arguments will be filled according to your configuration inputs.

Parameters

  • arg_obj – Arguments object that holds parameters needed for inference.

  • logger – Common logger object for logging coherence.

  • get_functions – Functions associated with parameters given.

Returns

None

Section Inference¶

core.python.infer_section.infer_section_sync(arg_obj, logger, get_functions)¶

Infer on section data synchronously. In order to use this in your configuration, specify infer_type as section_sync. Section inference requires that additional parameters such as slice, subsampl, and slice_no be specified in the JSON configuration file. This function’s specific arguments will be filled according to your configuration inputs.

Parameters

  • arg_obj – Arguments object that holds parameters needed for inference.

  • logger – Common logger object for logging coherence.

  • get_functions – Functions associated with parameters given.

Returns

None

core.python.infer_section.infer_section_async(arg_obj, logger, get_functions)¶

Infer on section data asynchronously. In order to use this in your configuration, specify infer_type as section_async. Section inference requires that additional parameters such as slice, subsampl, and slice_no be specified in the JSON configuration file. This function’s specific arguments will be filled according to your configuration inputs.

Parameters

  • arg_obj – Arguments object that holds parameters needed for inference.

  • logger – Common logger object for logging coherence.

  • get_functions – Functions associated with parameters given.

Returns

None
